Class Style

  • java.lang.Object
    • Style

  • public class Style
extends java.lang.Object
    Defines the presentation style of a word and provides basic functionality to combine styles and to render the corresponding HTML representation.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Style()
      Creates a default style with no bold, italic, or underline.
      Style(boolean isBold, boolean isItalic, boolean isUnderline)
      Creates a style with the given properties.

      Gets whether the style is italic.

      Gets whether the style is underline.

        public Style()
        Creates a default style with no bold, italic, or underline.

      • Style

        public Style(boolean isBold,
     boolean isItalic,
     boolean isUnderline)
        Creates a style with the given properties.
        Parameters:
        isBold - - whether the style is bold
        isItalic - - whether the style is italic
        isUnderline - - whether the style is underline

    • Method Detail

      • generateTagClose

        public java.lang.String generateTagClose()
        Generates the HTML close tags corresponding to the open tags for the style; e.g., 
         </b>
        The nesting must be preserved.
        Returns:
        the tags
        See Also:
        generateTagOpen()

      • generateTagOpen

        public java.lang.String generateTagOpen()
        Generates the HTML open tags for the style; e.g., 
         <b>
        The order is arbitrary, but the close tags must correspond.
        Returns:
        the tags
        See Also:
        generateTagClose()

      • intersect

        public void intersect(Style style)
        Modifies this style by intersecting it with another. For example, 
         new.isBold = (current.isBold AND style.isBold)
        Parameters:
        style - - the style to apply

      • isBold

        public boolean isBold()
        Gets whether the style is bold.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns the string representation of this object in the form: 
         "Style{isBold=" + _isBold + " isItalic=" + _isItalic + " isUnderline=" + _isUnderline + "}"
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        the representation

      • union

        public void union(Style style)
        Modifies this style by unioning it with another. For example, 
         new.isBold = (current.isBold OR style.isBold)
        Parameters:
        style - - the style to apply
